[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@cerbos/react](./react.md)

## react package

## Functions

<table><thead><tr><th>

Function


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[CerbosProvider({ children, client, principal, auxData, })](./react.cerbosprovider.md)


</td><td>

Component to provide the Cerbos client to down the component tree, should be placed closer to the root of the application. The principal is required but can be an anonymous user in case your application requires authorization checks for unauthenticated users.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[useCerbos()](./react.usecerbos.md)


</td><td>

Hook to access the provided Cerbos client. It is perfectly fine to access the client directly, however, consider using one of [useCheckResource()](./react.usecheckresource.md)<!-- -->,[useCheckResources()](./react.usecheckresources.md) or [useIsAllowed()](./react.useisallowed.md) instead. The API they provide might be simpler for your use case as the handle the Async logic for you.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[useCheckResource(request, options)](./react.usecheckresource.md)


</td><td>

Check a principal's permissions on a resource.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[useCheckResources(request, options)](./react.usecheckresources.md)


</td><td>

Check a principal's permissions on a set of resources.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[useIsAllowed(request, options)](./react.useisallowed.md)


</td><td>

Check if a principal is allowed to perform an action on a resource.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
